mixed-citation.article-title: Acroterius gen. nov. (Araneae: Linyphiidae: Linyphiinae) with twelve new species from Yunnan, China

tp:taxon-treatment.tp:nomenclature:
Acroterius longiprojectus
gen. et sp. nov.

tp:treatment-sec.p:
The new species resembles
Acroterius hamatus
gen. et sp. nov. ( Fig. 19A–D ) in having long parmula in epigyne ( Fig. 34B–E ); it can be distinguished by: the posterior projection of the anterior wall of the epigynal plate longer than wide ( Figs 34B–C ), but wider than long in
A. hamatus
gen. et sp. nov. ( Figs 19A–B , 21A–B ). In ventral view, the distal part of parmula is not expanded ( Fig. 34B–C ), but distinctly expanded in
A. hamatus
gen. et sp. nov. ( Fig. 19A–B ). The spermathecae are not curved ( Fig. 34E ), but the tip is curved, pointing towards the posterior margin of the epigyne in
A. hamatus
gen. et sp. nov. ( Figs 19D , 21D ).

The species name comes from the Latin adjective ‘ longus ’ + ‘ projectus ’ meaning ‘long’ + ‘projection’, referring to the long posterior projection of the anterior wall of the epigynal plate in the epigyne.
